ca.cgjennings.spelling.dict

Class FrequencyAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.cgjennings.spelling.dict.FrequencyAnalyzer

  • public class FrequencyAnalyzer
extends Object
    A FrequencyAnalyzer is used to analyze one or more texts in order to generate word frequency statistics. It can be used when building a dictionary to add information about the relative frequency of words.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  FrequencyAnalyzer.AbstractCorpusProcessor
      A abstract base class for corpus processors that processes files one line at a time.
      static class  FrequencyAnalyzer.ColumnDataFileProcessor
      A corpus processor that counts preprocessed data.
      static interface  FrequencyAnalyzer.CorpusProcessor
      A corpus processor tokenizes a corpus file into words and informs a FrequencyAnalyzer of the words that it encounters.
      static class  FrequencyAnalyzer.ProseProcessor
      A corpus processor that processes prose text.
      class  FrequencyAnalyzer.WordCounter
      A callback object that allows a FrequencyAnalyzer.CorpusProcessor to register the words that it observes with this FrequencyAnalyzer.

    • Method Detail

      • applyRanks

        public void applyRanks()
        This is called after all of the sample text has been processed in order to generate the rank data and store it in the word list.

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clears all recorded statistics, resetting this instance to its initial empty state.

      • createWordCounter

        protected FrequencyAnalyzer.WordCounter createWordCounter()
        Returns a new word counter. Subclasses can override this to use a custom word counter implementation. Word counters should themselves be stateless; each FrequencyAnalyzer instance creates a single word counter and reuses it for each corpus.
        Returns:
        a new word counter

      • getCorpusProcessor

        public FrequencyAnalyzer.CorpusProcessor getCorpusProcessor()
        Returns the current corpus processor used to process files.
        Returns:
        the current processor

      • getLocale

        public Locale getLocale()
        Returns:
        the locale

      • getMispellingList

        public Set<String> getMispellingList()

      • getPolicy

        public WordPolicy getPolicy()
        Returns:
        the policy

      • getStatPotentialGroups

        public int getStatPotentialGroups()
        Returns the number of potential frequency groupings; that is the number of unique word groups where each group has the same frequency. This only returns a meaningful value after calling applyRanks().
        Returns:
        the number of potential frequency groups

      • getStatTotalWordCount

        public long getStatTotalWordCount()
        Returns the total number of words that were observed over all of the corpora that were processed. (Not the number of unique words.) This only returns a meaningful value after calling applyRanks().
        Returns:
        the total number of observed words

      • getStatUniqueWordCount

        public int getStatUniqueWordCount()
        Returns the number of unique words for which frequency information was added to the dictionary. This only returns a meaningful value after calling applyRanks().
        Returns:
        the number of unique words

      • getWordList

        public RankedList getWordList()

      • process

        public void process(File corpus)
             throws IOException
        Processes the text in the specified corpus using the current FrequencyAnalyzer.CorpusProcessor. This is equivalent to calling process( corpus, "utf-8" );
        Parameters:
        corpus - the corpus to process
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs
        See Also:
        process(java.io.File, java.lang.String)

      • process

        public void process(File corpus,
                    String charset)
             throws IOException
        Processes the text in the specified corpus using the current FrequencyAnalyzer.CorpusProcessor, recording its word frequency data. The charset parameter is passed as a hint to the corpus processor to indicate a suggested encoding for the file. (Some processors may ignore it.)
        Parameters:
        corpus - the file to process
        Throws:
        IOException - if an I/O error occurs

      • processEquivalencies

        public void processEquivalencies(File equivCorpus)
                          throws IOException
        Throws:
        IOException

      • processEquivalencies

        public void processEquivalencies(File equivCorpus,
                                 String charset)
                          throws IOException
        Process an equivalency table. Each line in the file must contain two or more words that should be considered equivalent, separated by whitespace. For example, the spellings colour versus color would be made equivalent with the line "colour color". Occurrences of any of these words will be counted for all. Any equivalency files should be processed before the first corpus in a set. Any given word may only appear once in the file.
        Parameters:
        equivCorpus -
        charset -
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setCorpusProcessor

        public void setCorpusProcessor(FrequencyAnalyzer.CorpusProcessor proc)
        Sets the corpus processor used to process files.
        Parameters:
        proc - the new processor to set

      • setLocale

        public void setLocale(Locale locale)
        Parameters:

        public void setPolicy(WordPolicy policy)
        Parameters:
        policy - the policy to set

      • setWordList

        public void setWordList(RankedList wl)
        Sets the word list that statistics will be created for. This is also used to verify words from the processed files.
        Parameters:
        wl -
